subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit
msgSnippet: John, JUnit is not implemented differently in VAJ -- it is the same distribution as everyone else.  The only thing is that Kent and Erich put in some checks to
messageBody:
John,

JUnit is not implemented differently in VAJ -- it is the same distribution as
everyone else. The only thing is that Kent and Erich put in some checks to see
whether you were running in VAJ or not for (I think) ClassLoader issues and
non-packaged classes (that is, classes w/o a package statement). This is all
transparent to the user. As far as I am concerned, as the client of the
framework, the implementation is the same whether I am running in VAJ or
against the file system.

-jason

--- John Clarke <john@...> wrote:
> Andoni,
> ahhh i c , well the way JUNIT is implemented in Visual Age is a little more
> useful than in JBuilder, but then I am just trying to learn that IDE
> (JBuilder) to see if it is any good for my purposes. Visual Age is quite
> nice though once you're into it. Like all these things it's quite subjective
> and the only way to find out is to try them , I got the IBM Visual Age for
> Java from IBM on a developer disk which was helpful, (I develop on NT).
> john
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Andoni O'Conchubhair [mailto:andoni.oconchubhair@...]
> Sent: 21 December 2001 12:20
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit
>
>
> Just that I write my java (tests and all) from a text editor and I have
> noticed from what people say that they don't all hand-write tests and I was
> wondering what (or how much) the IDE does for you?
>
> Andoni.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: John Clarke [mailto:john@...]
> Sent: 21 December 2001 12:24
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit
>
> just how it's installed and used, for example the implementation in Jbuilder
> is different to Visual Age...
> ?
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Andoni O'Conchubhair [mailto:andoni.oconchubhair@...]
> Sent: 21 December 2001 12:01
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit
>
>
> What do you mean by 'it depends on your IDE'????
> Can you explain this?
>
> Andoni.
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: John Clarke [mailto:john@...]
> Sent: 21 December 2001 12:06
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit
>
> sid,
> it depends on your IDE so as Bernd says ...
> see the papers on www.junit.org which are quite helpful.
> john
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Bernd Proissl [mailto:lists@...]
> Sent: 21 December 2001 11:56
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit
>
>
> > can any one help me out.
> > ia'm going for a java exam and i need to test my code which i decided
> > i'll do using JUNIT.
> > can anyone help me out in that.
>
> see the papers on www.junit.org
>
> Bernd
>
